bug.short_desc: xref cache is not updated if code changes in SRC_ROOT

long_desc.thetext:
webapplication still shows old cache even if the file in SRC_ROOT has newer date e.g. http://grok.czech.sun.com:8080/source/xref/sfwnv-clone/usr/src/lib/slang/METADATA
[lk162707@ba64-v20zd-prg06]:pts/3:32 Jobs:0 Today: Tue Jan 05, 9:56 /ws-local/sfwnv-clone/usr/src/lib/slang>% ls -l /opengrok/data/xref/sfwnv-clone/usr/src/lib/slang/METADATA.gz -rw-r--r-- 1 webservd webservd 509 Dec 16 11:02 /opengrok/data/xref/sfwnv-clone/usr/src/lib/slang/METADATA.gz
[lk162707@ba64-v20zd-prg06]:pts/3:33 Jobs:0 Today: Tue Jan 05, 9:56 /ws-local/sfwnv-clone/usr/src/lib/slang>% ls -l METADATA -r--r--r-- 1 vk199839 staff 551 Jan 4 11:07 METADATA
meaning that we should fall back either to on demand generation of xref (as we do with economic index - xref not generated) , or web app should update the cache if it figures out it looks at old cached files
I have also a bad feeling xref will not be regenerated if we index it again, so one should also definitely check whether indexer refreshes xrefs properly ...

maybe the webapp could also try to update the xref cache ... though since this is a problem in between the source update and indexer finished it doesn't make much sense and properly it should wait until indexer writes the proper xref ...

The webapp will not run ctags on the input file, so the xref generated by the webapp is less detailed than the one generated during indexing. Let's rather regenerate it every time the user requests it until the indexer catch up...
